types.name: Username
types.description: 길이는 2 ~ 15, 영문, 한글, 숫자

types.name: URL
types.description: A field whose value conforms to the standard URL format as specified in RFC3986: https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt.

types.name: PhoneNumber
types.description: A field whose value conforms to the standard E.164 format as specified in: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164. Basically this is +17895551234.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ObjectID
types.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

types.name: Date
types.description: A date string, such as 2007-12-03, compliant with the `full-date` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: Cover
types.description: 커버한 데이터

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: DateTime
types.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Time
types.description: A time string at UTC, such as 10:15:30Z, compliant with the `full-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: Timestamp
types.description: The javascript `Date` as integer. Type represents date and time as number of milliseconds from start of UNIX epoch.

types.name: UtcOffset
types.description: A field whose value is a UTC Offset: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

types.name: Duration
types.description:
A string representing a duration conforming to the ISO8601 standard,
    such as: P1W1DT13H23M34S
    P is the duration designator (for period) placed at the start of the duration representation.
    Y is the year designator that follows the value for the number of years.
    M is the month designator that follows the value for the number of months.
    W is the week designator that follows the value for the number of weeks.
    D is the day designator that follows the value for the number of days.
    T is the time designator that precedes the time components of the representation.
    H is the hour designator that follows the value for the number of hours.
    M is the minute designator that follows the value for the number of minutes.
    S is the second designator that follows the value for the number of seconds.

    Note the time designator, T, that precedes the time value.

    Matches moment.js, Luxon and DateFns implementations
    ,/. is valid for decimal places and +/- is a valid prefix

types.name: ISO8601Duration
types.description:
A string representing a duration conforming to the ISO8601 standard,
    such as: P1W1DT13H23M34S
    P is the duration designator (for period) placed at the start of the duration representation.
    Y is the year designator that follows the value for the number of years.
    M is the month designator that follows the value for the number of months.
    W is the week designator that follows the value for the number of weeks.
    D is the day designator that follows the value for the number of days.
    T is the time designator that precedes the time components of the representation.
    H is the hour designator that follows the value for the number of hours.
    M is the minute designator that follows the value for the number of minutes.
    S is the second designator that follows the value for the number of seconds.

    Note the time designator, T, that precedes the time value.

    Matches moment.js, Luxon and DateFns implementations
    ,/. is valid for decimal places and +/- is a valid prefix

types.name: LocalDate
types.description: A local date string (i.e., with no associated timezone) in `YYYY-MM-DD` format, e.g. `2020-01-01`.

types.name: LocalTime
types.description: A local time string (i.e., with no associated timezone) in 24-hr `HH:mm[:ss[.SSS]]` format, e.g. `14:25` or `14:25:06` or `14:25:06.123`.

types.name: LocalEndTime
types.description: A local time string (i.e., with no associated timezone) in 24-hr `HH:mm[:ss[.SSS]]` format, e.g. `14:25` or `14:25:06` or `14:25:06.123`.  This scalar is very similar to the `LocalTime`, with the only difference being that `LocalEndTime` also allows `24:00` as a valid value to indicate midnight of the following day.  This is useful when using the scalar to represent the exclusive upper bound of a time block.

types.name: EmailAddress
types.description: A field whose value conforms to the standard internet email address format as specified in RFC822: https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc822/.

types.name: NegativeFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value less than 0.

types.name: NegativeInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value less than 0.

types.name: NonEmptyString
types.description: A string that cannot be passed as an empty value

types.name: NonNegativeFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: NonNegativeInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: NonPositiveFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value of 0 or less.

types.name: NonPositiveInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value of 0 or less.

types.name: PositiveFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value greater than 0.

types.name: PositiveInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value greater than 0.

types.name: PostalCode
types.description: A field whose value conforms to the standard postal code formats for United States, United Kingdom, Germany, Canada, France, Italy, Australia, Netherlands, Spain, Denmark, Sweden, Belgium, India, Austria, Portugal, Switzerland or Luxembourg.

types.name: UnsignedFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: UnsignedInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: BigInt
types.description: The `BigInt` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.

types.name: Long
types.description: The `BigInt` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.

types.name: Byte
types.description: The `Byte` scalar type represents byte value as a Buffer

types.name: UUID
types.description: A field whose value is a generic Universally Unique Identifier: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier.

types.name: GUID
types.description: A field whose value is a generic Universally Unique Identifier: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier.

types.name: Hexadecimal
types.description: A field whose value is a hexadecimal: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hexadecimal.

types.name: HexColorCode
types.description: A field whose value is a hex color code: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_colors.

types.name: HSL
types.description: A field whose value is a CSS HSL color: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#hsl()_and_hsla().

types.name: HSLA
types.description: A field whose value is a CSS HSLA color: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#hsl()_and_hsla().

types.name: IPv4
types.description: A field whose value is a IPv4 address: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv4.

types.name: IPv6
types.description: A field whose value is a IPv6 address: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv6.

types.name: ISBN
types.description: A field whose value is a ISBN-10 or ISBN-13 number: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number.

types.name: Latitude
types.description: A field whose value is a valid decimal degrees latitude number (53.471): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latitude

types.name: Longitude
types.description: A field whose value is a valid decimal degrees longitude number (53.471): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longitude

types.name: MAC
types.description: A field whose value is a IEEE 802 48-bit MAC address: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAC_address.

types.name: Port
types.description: A field whose value is a valid TCP port within the range of 0 to 65535: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transmission_Control_Protocol#TCP_ports

types.name: RGB
types.description: A field whose value is a CSS RGB color: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#rgb()_and_rgba().

types.name: RGBA
types.description: A field whose value is a CSS RGBA color: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#rgb()_and_rgba().

types.name: SafeInt
types.description: The `SafeInt` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values that are considered safe as defined by the ECMAScript specification.

types.name: USCurrency
types.description: A currency string, such as $21.25

types.name: Currency
types.description: A field whose value is a Currency: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217.

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: JSONObject
types.description: The `JSONObject` scalar type represents JSON objects as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: IBAN
types.description: A field whose value is an International Bank Account Number (IBAN): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Bank_Account_Number.

types.name: Void
types.description: Represents NULL values

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
